61Kf2Vf_1apWMMojP4riYw.text: Great place for a brunch!Cornbread french toast was fantastic (though paprika maple sirup is spicy;)And crumpets were perfect semi-sweet finishing of the meal:)

GfcmJBtQ4eeSjHiRRnbSlg.text: This place is simply awe-some!Had the best breakfast ever there! Loved it!P.S: don't count calories, but smiles that this food brings you!! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom

XIf8LBdvLk7D6DEEL2lf6A.text: Came here for brunch with a few friends and loved it. The menu is full of choices (I decided on the cornbread french toast), and the coffee is some of the best I've had so far in London. Food and service were both great. Definitely coming back before I leave.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom. Cornbread French toast. Super filling (and sooo good)

fSwlC4O211DskI82Jn0_5Q.text: Huge, huge fan of Caravan. This place has got to be one of the best brunch places in London. I had the luxury of going there on a Monday morning which means I did not have to endure a wait as I would have if I went on a weekend. It's located right at the start of Exmouth Market so you will not miss it.The atmosphere is rustic with lots of natural light coming in. I got the baked eggs which I'm still dreaming about today. My only regret was that I wasn't able to finish it because it was quite a lot of food. The baked eggs came in a mini metal casserole/pot with tomato and pepper ragout. There's an option of adding chorizo, which I did. The dish was drizzled with some Greek yoghurt. The server recommended that I add a slice of toast since the baked egg dish has a good amount of tomato and pepper ragout and I can soak it up with the bread-- fantastic idea. A single slice of the sourdough toast was pretty big so good thing I ordered a slice.Caravan also roasts their own coffee. Bonus points for that.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom. Baked eggs

ktG2SrxEyMdkscYN13Ex4g.text: I've been here twice and love it!I'm obviously not alone because there's usually a queue for brunch here at the weekends, even in heavy showers. Be prepared to take a number but know that it will be worth it once your food arrives.The restaurant itself is really nice, cool venue and lots of space for groups.I like this place because the quality of the food they serve is really high and they serve generous portions.The menu is interesting and lots of options for vegetarians, the health conscious and meat lovers.They don't take bookings for weekend brunch but they do have a table downstairs that seats 10/12 so if you can fill that they'll let you book. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom. Avocado on sour dough toast
Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom. Banana and chocolate smoothie and a cappuccino

FcUJN0F6gQddIhY9NUEktg.text: Stopped here for a dessert and a coffee while visiting my friend. Most places around were expensive restaurants or pubs, and well we just wanted some cake and coffee =)  We found some delicious desserts here and loved our deep rich lattes.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom. Mouse
Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom. Soya latte
Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom. Fancy cake

L1BtOyUoIU54uyKfatvErA.text: Truly gorgeous soy latte. Truly. I've been to the likes of Monmouth and try to be as excited as my coworkers about its espresso, but Caravan is more my speed (literally, I am buzzing around like a right weirdo after mid-afternoon Monmouth; Caravan was much smoother sailing).Tucked on a side street less than 10 mins from Farringdon Station, Caravan is more bar/restaurant than coffee shop (despite making it to more than a few Best of London Coffee lists AND having its own roastery in the basement). But don't let that deter you, because the food was great, too. Just worth noting in case you're expecting a coffee shop/hunker down and do some work vibe. There are no laptops in Caravan.I had the spicy tomato soup (£5.5) and a side of their famous cornbread (£4) and a fresh lemonade spritzer (£3). The latte was £4, plus 40p for soy. The corn bread was not the fluffy, finely coarsed buttery bread casserole of the American south, but thick slices of loaf style bread with hefty corn pieces and fried. I will repeat that: And. Fried. It came with a garnish of lime and plenty herb butter and was unlike anything I've ever had -- crispy, savory, slightly sweet and pretty much perfect. At 6pm on a Monday, most were enjoying glasses of wine and light bites in groups of 3+. Indoor/outdoor seating that includes picnic style and bistro tables. Total bill for two for a few small plates, two coffees and two non alkie drinks was £33 (including 12% service charge).Speaking of service, it was excellent right up until the end, when it took 25 minutes and asking three times to get the bill.

-0bEMJZNc22cGkH_kBXnVA.text: I came here for brunch on a Sunday morning. What a delightful brunch it was. First off, let me say the location is adorable. It's located on a  street with a whole bunch of little restaurants. It was the cutest thing I saw. The road is blocked off so you can't drive down it. But who would want it?! Way cuter to take the stroll. I wasn't feeling my snazziest due to a night of partying in Leicester Square the night before. I spotted the outdoor seating and decided we HAD to. We went in and were offered coffee as we sat by the coffee bar awaiting our seat. My friend, Denise C., ordered a cappuccino and I sat quietly observing how polite everyone was. The cappuccino was adorable! They made a leaf looking thing in it. So cute. When you give your name and wait to be called they give you a bag of coffee beans with a number on it. Creative and the smell of the coffee beans was a nice pick me up.We were seated at a little table out front after no more than 15 minutes. I decided on a ginger carrot turmeric drink because I hear turmeric is supposed to be really good for you. I needed SOMETHING to cure that night I had. To go along with my healthy fresh drink, i ordered the flour tortilla with eggs, beans, salsa and a side of amazingness. I'll start with the drink. It was definitely fresh (especially since I think my waitress forgot about it and I had to ask again). They were little chunks of freshness and the slight spice to it was a real wake up. With that drink and my delicious brunch I was cured in minutes. The eggs were tasty and the bean salsa concoction they had going on was out of this world. The perfect amount of flavor to compliment the tortilla and wake up my taste buds. It was all so delicious. I typically don't go for fresh fancy juice. I'm more of a mimosa girl with my brunch but with how I was feeling the juice was perfect and so was the food.I ran downstairs to the restroom. Its located beside the kitchen and in this cool area where I'm assuming they have for family dining style. Its a huge table. I would love to have a bunch of friends down their. The "loo" was clean and the soap had a really nice smell.As far as service, the waitress was nice as was the manager. The only thing...there was a young guy that came and sat with friends as we were dining and I don't know if he was some sort of celebrity or if he was an employee but our waitress and a few other employees were waiting on this kid hand and foot. Our waitress didn't really check on us that much but they were all hanging off of him. lol It was pretty weird to watch. But none the less I really enjoyed my experience here.I'll definitely return when I'm back in the UK.

FlvFrlxaCW5nlm4t3y8b0w.text: Caravan has some great coffee. Need I say more? They also have some toasts with avocado on them which taste great. Location-wise, it is wedged right at the mouth of the Exmouth market. They also have some candid and friendly staff who care enough to inform you when the portion sizes aren't that great for your order (so you can either replace or order more). I will certainly be frequenting this place often to taste their Rwandan coffee and other exotic blends!

sTUpFVP4WYjidIJq0sf7JQ.text: Nice place. Great location. Good service. However, the shredded duck salad I ordered came out super fast.  Not a problem, except the duck in the otherwise tasty salad was dry , chewy and hardly shredded. I had to hack away at large chunks of it to make it chewable and digestible. It was quite dry.  Truth be told it is my first time eating duck in London, but I lived in Paris for one year.  It is possible to keep duck for duck salad from being completely dry and chewy yes? And even if not, if one orders shredded duck salad, the duck should be shredded  right? Anyway, at 15 pounds for the salad I was a bit dissatisfied. Last night I ate up at Niche on Rosebery and had a cobb salad that was cheaper and way better.  But maybe it's impossible to keep duck tender for shredded duck salad, and I am in the wrong here. A nice environment for drinks nonetheless.

aOvdu6jJ7SAGekGlnuNvJg.text: We loved the french toast!  Very friendly staff, seating outside was nice even when there was a short rain shower.

7sB1nbRMef4La41VXpSedA.text: Kind of a tight squeeze but we were seated right away and served quickly. I like this one better because of the brighter space. Nice place to start if you're having a mooch around the street. Had the mushrooms on toast with a poached egg.

JQFJ0seIEKIFVk6IqBdqGQ.text: My friends and I came here for brunch this past weekend. The place was packed and we had to wait about 20 minutes for a table, but it was definitely worth it. We started out with hot chocolate and lattes, which I got a huge kick out of because they draw patterns in the foam. My friends weren't completely happy with the choices but Caravan was very accommodating and they were able to create their own eggs Benedict's by ordering the sourdough bread with poached eggs and getting sides of hollandaise, goat cheese, mushrooms, etc. They also got the orange-scented pancakes which are probably the best pancakes I've tried in Europe so far--extremely fluffy and flavorful! The blueberry compote on top was also wonderful.I ordered a blueberry muffin, sourdough with butter, and the cornbread French toast. The French toast was so good that I finished it in literally ten minutes. The unexpected combination of sweet and savory with the added bitterness of the arugula was exactly what I was looking for. As many before me have said, their sourdough bread was delicious. My only disappointment was the muffin, which I found too sweet and dense for my liking.Prices overall were pretty good considering how expensive London is in general.We plan to come here one more time before leaving London next week and I'm already excited for it!

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom. Cornbread French toast w rocket and bacon
Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom. Blueberry muffin
Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom. Latte

fIF2pB2EXeVy0J0bmSB5QA.text: This place is everything I love about brunch rolled up into a modern on the inside, rustic on the outside, cafe. It's simple; it's savory; it's sweet. The flavor combinations on the menu are not your typical French Toast and Fry-up. They are exciting and attention-grabbing. The Baked Eggs with Tomato Ragout, Greek Yogurt, and Chorizo caught my attention and my friend and I had it to share. Gorgeous combination of spicy sausage, palate cooling cream, and fresh and peppery ragout. The eggs blended in effortlessly. Home Run. Might come again for that alone.Though as we sat outside, eyeing the menu, I noticed other unlikely brunch ideas such as Cornbread French Toast, Bacon, Rocket, and Avocado. Along with Grilled Coconut Bread, Strawberries, and Lemon Curd Cream Cheese. Goes without saying that I'll be back. Definitely on the high-end breakfast side and is a hell of a wait at the busy times. My only negative was the manager telling some people that they had to pay or leave when they used their laptops after their food was done. I am not a fan of that- but seeing how busy they get, I do understand that everyone should get a chance to enjoy this place sitting down!Possible dinner items on my "Salivate List"--Arabica Oxtail, Herbs, Creme Fraiche Polenta--Sichuan Salt and Pepper Pork Belly with Tofu Salad, Gooseberries, Mache, and Pumpkin Seeds--Almond Couscous, Tomato Ragout, Aubergine, and Sumac Yoghurt

xjOvbzhZJnXww7u_LDyKUg.text: 30 minute wait for brunch on a Sunday @ 11AM. Not too shabby. The place is a madhouse though.My little party of 3 were anxiously awaiting for a table at Caravan this morning. We were all starving & salivating at the sight of all the dishes that passed by. We decided on sharing everything, which I'm a huge fan of because then we can try everything.ORANGE SCENTED PANCAKES, HONEYCOMB BUTTER & BLUEBERRIES - Mmmmmm. A stack of 2, light pancakes with a huge glob of their honeycome butter on it and a side of blueberry jam. Fan-freaking tastic. Highly recommend getting this and sharing.BAKED EGGS, TOMATO & PEPPER RAGOUT, GREEK YOGURT W/ CHORIZO - Very tasty. Although not really typical of breakfast food, it was still very nice this early in the day. Get some extra bread to dip in to this as well.CORNBREAD FRENCH TOAST, BACON, ROCKET, AVOCADO, W/ PAPRIKA MAPLE - One of my favorites at the table! Not too sweet, but still soooooo good. I love the sweet mixed with savory. CHILLI BEANS, GOAT CHEESE, & FRIED EGG ON GRAIN TOAST - My friends loved this. I was indifferent, but if you're a fan of all that is listed then you'll probably love it too.The food & service is all pretty good. If you're coming in on the weekends, be prepared for a wait. It is very busy so expect it to be noisy.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom. Fry-up
Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom. Mmmm brunch
Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom. Juice!

dTvXiSwK8mO9V2R9sSoSBQ.text: On the road again.What can I say. It's been a long week of business travel and I could take any more corporate chicken or beef options. I stopped by caravan purely on its curb park and its proximity to my hotel.I deliberately didn't asked for a wine list, I simply asked for a big red. Straight away they got I was beat and just needed a good meal and a good glass of wine. I had the great fortune of being servers by Niamh and Simon. They guided my food and wine choices with skill. I had 3 fantastic tasting plates and a phenomenal reintroduction to Malbec.  Just a great experience. It's easy to forget why, but this place is the reason you go out to eat.Later that year.....10/04/2018Sometimes when you go to a restaurant they are on their game and it's just good luck you go that night. When you go four months later and still have a great experience, it's not just luck, but when you go again and again and it is better each time there is only one conclusion, This place is great! Bizzare and wonderful cocktails, tofu that any meat-eater would give his arm to taste, seriously if the other other dishes weren't so great I'd give this vegan thing a go. I have the good fortune of being in London every 4 months and this will be a staple.

SVF0jZvMxivqKTmenm3BJQ.text: I came across this place when looking for a good spot for a last minute brunch. I am so happy to of found Caravan! We had a great table outside and being located on a street with no cars made for a relaxing atmosphere.The Sunday brunch menu had a great mix of savory & sweet, healthy & indulgent which was perfect for our group of 4 with different tastes! My husband and I split the granola w/ golden milk (genius!), smoothie bowl, and coconut bread. Everything was seriously delicious. The other 2 people in our party ordered savory waffles/eggs & cornbread/eggs with bacon and loved every bit of it.I've already tried to recreate the granola w/ golden milk at home. It is such a creative combination of trendy items and so yummy. I look forward to going back and trying other things on the menu including the espresso martini that everyone seemed to be drinking!

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom. Granola with Golden Milk, Coconut Bread & Smoothie Bowl

zMNfRIERRdUulxHAbNj_nw.text: My Mom and I had a delicious brunch here. Interesting food combinations, hearty portions, reasonable prices, and a good mix of indulgent and healthy options. I'd come back here again for brunch - no super long lines and a cute ambiance with natural light makes for an excellent brunch. I wouldn't necessarily trek across London to come here, but if you're in the area or relatively close by, it's a great place.Red quinoa & oat almond milk porridge (£6) - This came with bananas and dates for a little natural sweetness, and it was hearty and healthy. Jalapeno cornbread, frijoles negros, fried eggs, avocado (£9.50) - I've never had savory French toast before, and this was fantastic. I love cornbread and Mexican food, so this was a perfect combination and very unique. I'd highly recommend this! Overall, great selection of food - we enjoyed our meal a lot and my Mom kept wanting to come back here for breakfast/brunch. They have a good selection of sweet / savory / healthy / indulgent options, so everyone should be able to find something they want to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom. Jalapeno cornbread, frijoles negros, fried eggs, avocado (9.50)
Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom. Red quinoa & oat almond milk porridge (6)

yRPGkxPG3eyZRzw0AOMLjw.text: My husband's office is above Caravan, and I'm sure glad it is. It's the perfect spot to have a latte with a laptop, eat breakfast with a baby or have a cheeky lunch date. It's a good restaurant that is acceptable for all occasions, and that's shockingly hard to come by in any city, even lovely London.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom. Sausages, eggs on toast and a latte.

dtjmE7ygzU0Q7SMuVqaicg.text: I've been here for brunch twice and had a great experience both times. The Exmouth Market location is on a lovely street and is exactly what you're looking for in a weekend brunch spot. It can get a bit crowded but if you have to wait to get a table it shouldn't take long. The brunch menu is so great that it was hard to choose what to order. The first time I was here, I asked the waiter for his opinion and he suggested the jalapeño cornbread with tomatillo salsa, cotija, and eggs -- I'm glad I took his advice, because it was incredible! The cornbread had the texture of polenta but was much more flavorful, and the cotija and salsa paired so well together. The plate was large but we took our time eating and I finished the whole thing. I ordered the aubergine puree and egg plate the second time, which was also delicious although it could have used a bit more seasoning. My friend didn't like the smoothie bowl that she ordered but our waiter took it off of the bill without us even requesting it. Great, friendly staff, delicious food, reasonable prices, and a cozy atmosphere -- I definitely recommend coming here for brunch!

Rq8CuZKJYu7j4LyLrVjvDQ.text: I am here for breakfastGreat place for breakfast, original plates well prepared with good healthy sides. Great coffee. We had plates and they where very hearty.ambiance nice, really good music, very nice staff. It is, for me, a little loud but not as much as elsewhere. I am learning this is the norm in London.RecommendedMy daughter insists I say there is exfoliating gel in the toilets. Me I don't care LOL

3LWlNp-zjiAYLvXK24y3hg.text: Been here once before for din din and today was my first time for brunch. Amazing! Sat at the bar, but the wait didn't seem that long, and the guys here are great. Good service, so friendly, and coupled with great drinks and food.Had the avocado toast, which was yummy, and paired that with crumpets and butter. So decadent, wish I had asked for some jam with it. The soy latte was delicious, perfectly roasted, nutty and strong. I also tried the carrot, apple and ginger juice that's freshly made. Delicious!Highly recommended. I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom

9Io1aVXhlMl_ZbkoubH0bg.text: Poor menu choice. I got the cabbage and goat's cheese and it came in a ridiculously small plate, I was not even able to cut the cabbage and the sauce made it really messy and difficult not to spill it over the table. The cheese was terrible, taste was so strong, much stronger than normal goat's cheese. Broccoli way too oily. Fries are not even gluten free so I guess they just buy the frozen ones. The place is very loud too. Just terrible.

O5vIcPxuafBGmIdDu5bweg.text: Exmouth market is lovely and a nice place with a lot of atmosphere to have brunch. The food is very good, no question. The oats banana spirulina smoothie tastes amazing and is becoming one of my breakfast regulars at home :-) It's the London price you pay for very good food - reading a little pricey for the portion size but we've come to terms with that situation - I personally don't mind, just be aware if you are a good eater and very hungry. The bit that annoyed me as aspiring vegan - you better like granola if you're like-minded. It's literately the only vegan option. Even the toast with tomato or mushroom comes covered in butter (menu doesn't mention butter so you won't find out until it is served) and the mushrooms are actually cooked in butter which, apart from not vegan, is generally speaking not a great idea cause you should not heat butter. They are not able to use oil even if you ask! Last but not least, they charge 50p for soya milk on top of 2.80 for the coffee. Really? Pretending to be a hipster place but punishing those with lactose intolerance or ethical convictions...Not sure really how many stars to award. 5 if you want a glossed over hipster place with good food, only 2 if you were expecting an authentic place, where one big sparkly star is for taste and the second one for the lovely smiley waitress who served us

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom. Brunch

XiiLhTb_ryc0MlboJSKX9A.text: Awful breakfast. Nice staff but not very attentive. When most of the food goes uneaten, you might think to inquire why. Why? Because the soft scrambled eggs were overcooked and tasted powdered, old. The toast they sat on was soggy. The smoked salmon that came with it was flavorless. The Coffee was good. The water was never refilled. I hope the cafe across the street can make me some toast. I hope I get my bill this decade. I hope the food back in New York takes this powdered egg-like taste out of my mouth. I hope...  Also, I won't be coming back.

BfJxC2zR6Ju1M1Ci0ETzfA.text: Lovely coffee spot! The coffee here is delicious, and the exmouth market store has a good bustling ambience.

QvIA3wqMQKGvKwJfd6ZFsQ.text: Cute tapas type restaurant located in a bustling less touristy area. Fav dishes were ham hock, purple sprouting broccoli and sea bass dumplings. Fried cornbread and croquettes were also tasty.

_U1wdIK3gNFpaE_WG329sg.text: One of the more popular brunch spots in the area. Love the atmosphere, very laid back and casual. The coffee is excellent and well-bodied. I decided I had to try their infamous cornbread French toast, which was interesting to say the least. It was certainly unique, quite spicy with a spiced maple syrup. The spice was a little much for me, but it was pretty good. The rest of the brunch menu looks delicious, so I'll be sure to come back

M1NvjgGK2jActd8YYspLKA.text: Had Baked eggs, yogurt, flatbread and sausage option. Real good. Flat white too. Tables were a little busy on Saturday for brunch but if you only care about the food and are ok sitting near the bar, seats are free. Service was fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom. Baked eggs, yogurt, flat bread and sausage

A39_su07neFIpGX9uUa9EA.text: I liked the atmosphere of this place -- we sat outside on the street, which was lovely. But, I found it a bit overpriced for what you got and while the service was good, despite it being busy, I just wasn't that into it.I got a coffee with soya, which was served in an erlenmeyer flask because hipsters. Within minutes my coffee was lukewarm, but it looked cute. We decided to share the "grilled coconut bread, strawberries and lemon curd cream cheese", but for £7.50 it was a very tiny portion and quite dry. It was listed with the mains, so we were confused why it was more of a starter portion. We could've gotten a full English for a pound more.The coffee was good and I love Exmouth Market's atmosphere, so I didn't *hate* it and I'd return, but eh. I feel lukewarm about it... like my coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom. Tiny hipster coffee looks cute, tastes good, cools quickly.

O8i35-bOb-117jGJ2ZSxow.text: Let me throw a few more paprika-maple-syrup-drenched stars on Caravan...Firstly, the cornbread "french toast" with avocado, rocket and BACON? I highly recommend. Why has no one thought of this before!? Simply wonderful and achieved that super fine balance of sweet and savory in one dish that I always dream of in a breakfast. Harmony! Satisfied! I was lucky enough to arrive on a perfectly crisp and sunny brunchy morning midweek (Wednesday) so avoided any wait times (a la weekend). I was quickly seated and equipped with water and drinks while I awaited my dining companion. Service was friendly, but a bit aloof/absentminded. Drinks from the bar/barista took unusually long -- but I was not in  rush so it wasn't terribly important. They do quite a bit of takeaway coffee business as well so I presume it backs up the bar. Their brunch menu is succinct, but packs a punch. Ask around and you'll definitely hear "cornbread french toast" muttered more than once, so take the hint and try for yourself. A must in Exmouth Market. Add it to the rotation!

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom

N80M7YxKTAaBI0htQpV5kQ.text: Ended up here for dinner one night after exploring the area. This is a really cute location - located at the end of a street with a  bunch of little restaurants. We ordered a few small plates to share which included the potato and onion tortilla, miso cured salmon, crispy lamb, and bread and butter. My favorite was hands down the potato and onion tortilla - really tasty. Also the bread is really good. All in all - a solid place. Good service, good food, good area.

FJwqbbOM7sYMlMkZost2VQ.text: Have I not reviewed Caravan before? No? This is a travesty, truly.I love Exmouth Market (past reviews will attest) but Caravan is a special jewel in the Exmouth crown. I have never - not once - made it for food here. Which is a shame. That is both a disclaimer for this review, and also a gentle self-criticism. Pull it together, Alex!So what I can say is:Coffee is amazing. Drinks even better. Negronis even bestest.Last time I was here I had a gin and tonic glammed up with some orange and cucumber water. Yep.Also, the staff is great. Accommodating, and trying to fit you in even if you don't, y'know...*have the foresight to make a reservation* [see Yelp note, below].Yelp note: reservations recommended.

QYBv-sEz1ilTKucPu7ThCA.text: Really nice brunch spot in Kings Cross. It's a busy, trendy spot with and active vibe. I loved the baked goods and the food was simple but delicious. Seems like a good place for meeting friends or for large groups.

j1IoFybwC_wvKbYLLMRn-Q.text: Good food, but it is not my style. The place is great, I loved the design. Servers are also great. I had a good experience for dinner.

4Kp0m0J62N5SnJTA8C9qMw.text: My goodness, I LOVE this place.  My new favorite.  Went there for brunch on a Saturday.  All I can say is the savory cornbread french toast with rocket, bacon and avocado was just the BOMB.  The service was very good, and I love being able to get by-the-cup brewed fresh-roasted single origin FILTER coffee (hallelujah for filter coffee once in a while in this town).  I also loved that it was young (well when I say young 20 and 30 somethings, music was playing and it was hopping).  YAY!

nPd3lLN-EAxA_6czxGcMng.text: Excellent coffee, friendly baristas, delicious brunch. A bit pricey for the brunch, but quite tasty. Nice atmosphere, although loud on the weekend. Definitely will be gong back. Take some coffee beans with you; they're excellent (but expensive).

1FWdtso8rSEZ-IPYRtA8Vw.text: I really loved Caravan - very buzzy, New York style atmosphere - doors open onto the street - really cool, friendly staff...the menu is split into 'small plate' tapas dishes and main courses - which looked less exciting. I'd been warned the price can stack up, so we ordered fairly carefully - but it was all absolutely delicious. The menu was full of really interesting ideas - lots of unusual ingredients or combinations - some fusion and some more traditional stuff.I had warm, slightly toasted cornbread (with regular butter, not the advertised chilli one as I'm allergic to it) - and a 'small plate' of asparagus and poached egg with a really interesting sweet miso sauce. It all went really well with the cornbread - and I shared a side dish of sprouting broccoli with a sort of blackbean sauce with my friend. She had some peanut and blue cheese wantons (no, not my kind of thing either!) but she enjoyed them - and some cured salmon with cucumber... and we both had the chocolate espresso pudding for dessert. I asked for mine 'extra gooey' in the middle - and it came exactly right, with plenty of sauce oozing out, which is always the best bit of a chocolate fondant. Since they're a specialist coffee roaster, I had a decaff americano, but maybe the decaff isn't their strong suit... I can't wait to go back for brunch, though - and some of that cornbread french toast.

btjy2OLBfyjLkfqs9-IB6w.text: We had a dinner here recently after it opened and I'm still raving about it. They roast their own coffee downstairs in the roastery and it's an experience in itself - amazing froth art, great flavour and a flat white to die for. Small plates menu with what looks like a killer brunch - a few larger plates for those in our party who didn't want to share... Personal recommendations are the salt beef fritters, oxtail, wontons and the chocolate espresso dessert option. Must declare my interest as a fellow Kiwi - chef from Providores so it's the type of vibe and food I lurrrrve.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caravan - London, United Kingdom

n4uhr_UC5qYCiwiHtc8SJQ.text: If you're looking for a hearty and tasty brunch and crave a funky New York vibe - Caravan is the perfect spot.  Walked here a blistery and foggy day, and left really happy and sunny after my chili beans, cheese, and scrambled eggs.  I also had a nibble of the scrambled eggs and salmon, which was equally delectable.  They play really upbeat music and the waitresses didn't stop dancing to it, which adds to the cheerful vibe.  Will be back whenever I need a little cheering up on a dreary day.

aY2m3SJrO2ZDN_Xlx_pRTA.text: Came here after reading good reviews! Nice spot and drinks were nice but the food was awful. Everything vegetarian had some kind of curry poweder on it which ruined nice simple dishes! Cheese  for cheese board was melting and sweating - very unappealing. Waiter saw that we didn't touch half the food but didn't comment. Would only come back for drinks

yKUKkc-dXrYvWz4IBBC2jg.text: Really average for me. Corn bread frenchtoast one note of sweet especially with the syrup. Wanted more contrast. Waitress too busy tidying to properly serve us. Disappointing as its so highly regarded.

-HsJYzun30_wXan9hxr57w.text: Time Out lists this place in the top places to Brunch, but I struggle to see how it isn't the number one. It gets very busy, but well worth the wait. The coffee is roasted on sure and is stunningly tasty, surpassed only by the food. You should definitely go.

eHw8sJMWxumE7wdGgR98Jg.text: Caravan is the new kid on the block in Farringdon. Trendy little cafe, bar and restaurant located at the entrance of Exmouth Market that serves up a mean coffee complete with barristas who are happy to explain the origin and brew process of what they serve. Came here for a nice Sunday brunch and was surprised to find some originals: cornbread french toast with bacon, rocket and avacado and poached eggs on wholegrain toast. Lively, yet relaxing vibe and all the daily newspapers you could ever want to get your hands on. Would definitely come back another weekend!

DSokpZmFKAYLyEV6lnxJuw.text: It was Saturday (late) morning and I'm craving a good brunch (oh yessum eggs.). After a meandering scooter through Clerkenwell I happen across Caravan in Exmouth Market. An absolute gem, seated outside in the sun with the friendliest staff and great coffee I could not have been happier. I went for eggs and the avocado & chilli, oh and a breakfast Bellini. Absolute magic. I feel a little guilty however with such a varied menu I really must go back for an evening meal.

CZAHFrHZQ8KXHky9fo3HZA.text: This place is awful - do not go here if you hate pretentious stuck up people with no education but think somehow that because they 'majored' in coffee, they rule the world! There is a reason why the likes of Starbucks do well - because they don't have stuck-up attitudes about something as menial as coffee - don't get me wrong, I love coffee but thinking about the wider problems in the world, is worrying about coffee as much as these guys do with heads up in a cloud really the way forward?! There are many things that changed the world and will continue to do so, but coffee ain't one of them. The guys that run this place simply screw what they can from poor coffee growers in third world countries and live in posh houses in gentrified parts of London and then say they are doing something worthwhile - I don't think so! Service was very poor and prices were ridiculous!

LBXRxBXqbuJVRc3xFqHF8g.text: Continuing the relentless takeover of the London coffee scene by Antipodeans, Caravan makes its battle cry heard not only with its delicious coffee (roasted on premises), but also with delicious food. Run by Kiwis, including Miles Kirby, who was chef at The Providores & Tapa Room in Marylebone for the past six years. So, these guys are the real deal. We had brunch there recently and were happy with our food. We sampled a scrumptious cheese muffin, light and fluffy scrambled eggs on thick sourdough, savoury and not greasy salt beef fritters, spicy chorizo, delectable coconut bread with lemon curd and tamarillo and cornbread french toast with bacon, avocado and rocket. All for about £12 each, including service (all tips go to the staff). Caravan is one of the newest additions to the Exmouth Market scene. It's located where the old and dingy Al's Bar was. The restaurant is bright, airy and welcoming. If you like architectural details, then check out their light fixtures - superb - and notice that they serve water out of Piquot coffee pots (they bought on eBay, of course) - niiice touch!

R0eFb9A1ruRNbwmaabFUTg.text: Great place. Fantastic coffee, and the best place on Exmouth Market for brunch. Very friendly staff and good service.

Vzkyvc3Zz5czq5BqiE2u7w.text: I really love the atmosphere at Caravan. It's casual and cool but still buzzing with life and the murmurs of other diners. I actually work at another establishment on Exmouth Market, but I have to admit I'm a fan of Caravan. The chili squid and scallops are great. Of course, no review of Caravan would be complete without a mention of the fabulous, rich coffee that's roasted downstairs. The staff are lovely and always friendly. Only issue I had last time was the beef cheek. It was a bit lacking in flavor and didn't love the polenta. Nevertheless, I will be back soon.

oKN6ovwUn6H5LevIAUsPjw.text: Caravan in Clerkenwell is a new brasserie with food inspired by Australia and New Zealand. Opened in late 2010, Caravan has already had a big impact in the local area and has had some great reviews including 4 stars from Timeout Magazine. My first impression was of a relaxed but fun atmosphere with subtle lighting and even though it was fairly busy, it managed to feel quite cosy. It seems to be 'new thing' to do Big and Small plates on a menu these days. Small plates are more like tapas that you share, where as Big Plates are more like a normal size main meal. As someone who likes to try many different types of food, small plates seem to suit me fine. We started with some unusual but yummy Blue Cheese and Peanut Butter Wontons and had Fried Chicken with Watermelon and Crispy Seabass with Thai Noodles for main, both of which were very tasty. Along with a lovely bottle of red wine and a scrummy Blueberry cocktail to finish, I left Caravan not only feeling satisfied but excited at the thought that I will return in the future to enjoy the treats they have in store for me. itsnosmallthing.weebly.c…

y0Tkt6uk8Ao0mqcNEMGsbw.text: I really love the atmosphere at Caravan. It's casual and cool but still buzzing with life and the murmurs of other diners. I actually work at another establishment on Exmouth Market, but I have to admit I'm a fan of Caravan. The chili squid and scallops are great. Of course, no review of Caravan would be complete without a mention of the fabulous, rich coffee that's roasted downstairs. The staff are lovely and always friendly. Only issue I had last time was the beef cheek. It was a bit lacking in flavor and didn't love the polenta. Nevertheless, I will be back soon.

hS3GmDVBZo7xWcMezJsVtw.text: An impromptu dinner date with an antipodean friend led us to Caravan what a disappointment! Service was very poor  the main problem seemed to be the lack of any kind of organisation coupled with almost universally space-cadetty staff, who were friendly just super disorganised. The outcome: long waits, inability to catch attention, wrong food orders arriving, mistakes on the bill. I can imagine that with the place half full of people drinking coffee, they might be able to pull it off, but a busy dinner service, no chance! Fine, well, what about the food then? Also extremely disappointing. We got a bunch of the smaller plates, all of which sounded great, but completely failed to live up to their promise. We had: minute steak (poorly cooked, under-seasoned and didn't think much about the toast/mayo thing); tofu and bean shoots in a vietnamese sauce, which completely lacked any punch; cured salmon, also curiously lacking in flavour; courgette pancake, a bit doughy but ok; duck egg, morcilla, and salsa, again lacking in flavour; something else that I genuinely can't remember (!). A good bottle on wine barely saved the night (credit to the wine list, it has a bunch of interesting, though pricey, bottles on it). I want to like this place, it's got a good vibe and an interesting concept, but I just can't see myself willingly going back there, especially considering the many other great options on Exmouth Market and in the local area.

pYwaHw4530_XIUoBFiRtzQ.text: I booked the roastery for my birthday dinner  everyone sits around one big table, while you are brought plate after plate of food to share (you can choose between a £25/head set menu and a £35/head one  we had the cheaper one and it was plenty). It was good to be able to try so many dishes, and also there are no arguments when the bill comes because you've all had the same thing. You can specify at the time of booking how many vegetarians there'll be, if anyone has food allergies etc and the chef will take this into account. What I like is that it doesn't feel stiff and cut off from the action like some private dining rooms in restaurants can do, as you can see what's going on in the kitchen and hear the buzz upstairs  as well as be as noisy as you want in your own party without bothering tables around you. We went back again a month or so ago  again as a private party, and it was equally good. Both times the service has been friendly and professional.

dwaI779Ngl_aV1SEivjfoQ.text: Absolutely stunning. To combine an exciting atmosphere, lots of noise and bustle with such breathtaking food is a serious accomplishment and chef Miles Kirby deserves massive kudos. The staff are helpful and attentive, the service, exemplary. Taste the Sichuan Salt & Pepper Pork Belly, the classic Schnitzel, seared onglet, the squid pancake, the lamb chump with pepper and mint, the amazing rabbit confit with black pudding terrine and you'll be transported to somewhere twice the price and impossible to book a table. But not Caravan. Put your name on the list and wait with some first class cocktails or really clever choices that make up the affordable wine list. And then when you sit down you'll be ready. Afterwards, linger to enjoy one of the variety of coffees roasted downstairs. Caravan is an important addition to the street where Moro used to stand all by itself. Caravan is a restaurant that's here to stay.

HqwtoqBtsLFTyDUPW7tHtg.text: Good food; great coffee. I recommend the avocado on sourdough for brunch. The service is good. I keep going back for more!

yszBRNdUI2agSm6dWenrzw.text: I was really excited to go there, so on a Sunday noon I walked down all the way from Camden to Caravan through sunny beautiful London. When I arrived there, it was pretty busy, I went in, looked for a place, and took a seat at one of several free tables. Soon one of the staff came around and I asked her if I need to order at the counter or if she would bring me a menu.Not long after that another service staff came along to tell me, that I should stand up and wait at the bar for about ten minutes, because this table was already taken. A few seconds later the other service woman came back with a water and the menu - how nice! But I had to tell her, that her colleague just told me to leave (or to wait ...). Sorry Caravan, but that really ruined my Sunday! This is definitely not the experience you want to have on a lazy sunny Sunday noon. Pretty much it is one of the worst possible experiences you could have on a nice and sunny Sunday when you're hungry and excited. The table I chose was completely empty, no left overs or anything, nothing that indicated that you need to register somewhere to get a table. Quite annoying. And actually, yes, unprofessional - if one waitress gives you the menu and the other kicks you out. So I cannot assess the food or the coffee, but anyway I think that ruining my Sunday noon deserves a bad rating! Instead of waiting for ten minutes, I made my way to Scandinavian Kitchen in Fitzrovia, thus my Sunday was saved. But Caravan, sorry, you've messed it up for now.

fLyZZeAskg8rrl1RMCEnTw.text: I've been to Caravan a few times for breakfast now and it's really, really good. The wait at the weekend can be a pain (especially if you have to endure my hangrieness) but if you can hold out, it's worth it.I had the fry-up on my most recent visit and every bit was excellent - the eggs, which I asked for scrambled, were incredible. I also tried a bit of the cornbread French toast and I think I'll be getting that next time. Serves are big and at around £10 are excellent price-wise.The toasted coconut bread would make an awesome bre-ssert shared among a few people if by some chance you have room after finishing your fry-up.The coffee's been a bit hit and miss but even on a bad day it's like a 7.Can't wait to go back.

sNtPZOxf-0idfh5PxVrKig.text: good and bustle-y atmosphere. came with a friend to catch up - we each ordered 2 small plates, which works for lunch.  i recommend the spinach pancakes - very tasty and quite filling!  razor clams - ok but i wouldn't get them again (then again, i'm not a die hard seafood person - it just sounded good that day). don't get the ginger lemonade - just tastes like watery ginger hold the lemonade. it's not the fastest service - so if you are going for a workday lunch, expect it to take a little while...

X-RyPgPDWN1vRt7wtpIQJg.text: Beautiful food. Great service. I'll be coming back.

DKHkUxVwZm5dR5UV9Z9Agw.text: I'm visiting London for a few days. Went out to Caravan for a nice friday evening meal. The service was prompt, courteous, attentive and polite. The food was interesting, satisfying and rather unique. They also provided a complimentary tasting item: pureed squash with nuts, sesame oil and i believe dried tomato, a nice treat.We ordered from the small items menu. So we got maybe 8 small plates of different meals. Each was tasty. The cold roast beef platter was a bit strange but overall I was pleased and happy!I really liked the pork schnitzel and the courgette loaf.

cYO6v7YCAfuJGjL6hG0Fzg.text: Great brunch spot. I will be back for more delicious food. We waited 30 minutes for a table for 4  on Sunday but it was so worth it. Coffee was tasty. Fast and friendly service.

ldPd4zXyy24qlDuT_EZk0g.text: What can I say? Antipodeans know how to do brunch! The first thing they got right was the Bloody Mary, followed closely by a top-notch Flat White. The brunch menu was perfect; not too out there but much more interesting than the standard full English vs Eggs Bene you find just about everywhere else. Food was well presented and beautifully cooked and the service was quite charming. Exmouth Market is a lovely spot to sit out on a sunny day, slightly buffered from traffic sounds. We went for brunch and left around 3pm. Enough said really.

GhOmFjqwqCHcAuCvdxtd0A.text: Excellent place for breakfast, brunch or an afternoon coffee. The decor is a bit pretentious for my taste but I can live with it, as long as they keep making such good lattes.

-U3Ekx2bpByeYrHAivLCSw.text: Had to wait for a long time. You always have to chase the hostess around to make sure you are not being forgotten. Dishes are getting progressively smaller and worst. It is extremely loud inside. Also, they tried charging us £9 for a dish priced £7 on the menu. This is obv not a casual mistake because they had to change it on the bill from 'Spanish black pudding' to 'misc food item'. They didn't even apologise. Wonder how many people had been overcharged without noticing. Never coming back here again!Had to wait for a long time. Cl_5ZdnJQZr3jXiC6fKfrQ.text: We had to wait nearly 40 minutes at the bar for a table to become available, but it was definitely worth the wait. The food was delicious. But my favourite dish was the foie gras on gingerbread - they're definitely classic dishes with a twist. The service was impeccible and I would love to go there again.

wbBj_4qKgoCZFelKcLykJg.text: Your best bet for a weekday breakfast or brunch-type-event in Clerkenwell/Farringdon. Weekends work too, but the wait can be meaningful.Excellent bright space, very good coffee, and quite good breakfast/brunch. My last visit I enjoyed a startlingly good baked eggs skillet with chorizo--perfectly executed, with enough spice to keep me busy. I'd also highlight the "crumpets with too much butter." It's exactly (as just as awesome as) what it sounds like. Nothing better on a rare sunny morning than sitting outside on the Market with a coffee and the paper.Service has been hit or miss during my visits, especially during busy times. I've also never been in the afternoon or evening--while I know they have a full menu on offer, I've never tried it.

mHp4g3_z2dmD9UPXzuE8bQ.text: Having been to Caravan a few times for dinner, I knew I was a big fan of the small plates, although predisposed to like them, given that eating that way is my favorite way to go.  But I'd been really keen to go for breakfast and try the much-acclaimed baked eggs and chorizo.  Oh.  My.  Goodness.  Having lived in New York, I consider myself a bit of a brunch connoisseur.  This rivaled any brunch I have ever had anywhere, full stop.  Delicious eggs with a spicy, tasty tomato base topped with a dollop of Greek yogurt and lovely thick bread.It's a blessing and a curse that I live nearby, as clearly I will be eating this breakfast far too often for my own good!Service is slow, which is fine if you've got plenty of time to spare.  They don't hassle you to leave, which worked perfectly for me yesterday.Can I justify this breakfast two days in a row?  I think I just might . . .

MM4eP5sGeb1a1x8eMiU-ZA.text: This place looked like a great place to stop for lunch, tried the Onglet Steak here which was nice but not as impressive as the one I had recently tried at Market (Camden). Service was friendly, would return to try other items on the menu.

zrArn0IVmsCYxbkwvtEe3w.text: Caravan's certainly better than this Exmouth Market location's previous occupant. Whereas it was the scruffy and apatheticly so-so Al's Bar, it's now a light and accommodating dining space with prompt and friendly service. The menu is a perfect balance of intrigue and satisfaction - keep it in mind for weekend brunching when gluttons, gourmands and health nuts will all find suitable choices. The wine list, beers and booze are no fuss but well assembled. Coffee drinks live up to Kiwi standards. Most mains cost around £10 (portions are reasonable) with prices for starters, drinks etc falling inline accordingly. I'm not in love with Caravan, but the one time I dined here, I really liked it. One more yummy option for Clerkenwell - hooray!

J5m04Rpg0-wBjnt2LlshLg.text: I don't drink that much coffee but to be fair the coffee was excellent. The menu is brunch style, but unfortunately there was nothing which really jumped out at me. Nice laid back busy atmosphere.

58pd-sv678pCJ_6U31Pozg.text: enjoyed the cappuccino's with latte art &breakfast very much. friendly service. roast their own coffee beans.

KQKjcmxJ-xN0BlfV43t3tQ.text: nice place for breakfast. rather good coffee (own roastery). we were 8 people and could make a reservation on the big table downstairs. normally this is walk in only. staff was very friendly & attentative. nice latte artgood presentation of the sandwiches.

dgAZsrcFzO-ZElXTaQC6ZA.text: Best brunch in town. Try the avocado French toast - what a meddle of flavours.

Bgu0iVHeXZDshqFMY-_xsQ.text: I reguallally eat brunch in London and 'Caravan' has, so far, given me the best fry-up in London. If I can call it a fry-up that is as that seems to make it sound tacky - which it certainly isn't. Everything is brilliant about it, from the way that consistently come and re-fill your glass of water to the exceptional food. I had a fry-up with scrambled eggs which were certainly the best scrambled eggs I've had so far, the rest of the plate was also amazing which makes it the best fry-up I've had in London, the coffee tasted 'fresh' and lovely (it is roasted downstairs which you can check out if you pop to the loo), the service was polite, helpful and 'smiley' and the décor is modern and airy with little add-ons like the lights and the bar thus making 'Caravan' the best brunch and my favourite cafe in London. It is easy to get to with a short walk up from Farringdon and along from Angel. For those, like me, who weren't up for walking at that early hour (laaaazy) get the 38 bus from Angel which stops right outside. I recommend the full breakfast and the filter coffee and flat whites are great. I will be back soon to sample the other delights on the menu.
